item.title: Flight Management Computer Systems (FMCS) – One FMC/CDU Inoperative

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided en route operations do not require its use.

numlitem.para: Prior to dispatch, ensure the FMC instrument source select switch associated with the failed FMC is selected to ALTN.
Position both pilot’s HSI range selector to the same range scale to obtain a map for the side with the inoperative FMC.
LNAV and VNAV is available providing left or center autopilot is used.
LNAV and VNAV will arm but not capture unless 1) the left flight director is turned OFF and the right flight director is ON, or 2) the right autopilot is in Command.

entry.para: At 1,000 feet, select FL CH and position the command airspeed cursor to the zero flap maneuvering speed. This puts the autothrottles in the EPR mode and provides FL CH pitch guidance for flap retraction. LNAV and VNAV may be used once the right autopilot is engaged.

numlitem.para: Two FMCs required for departing from domestic gateways to Americas' Region destinations.

note.para: For operations to Central, South American and Mexico destinations ONLY, the flight may not depart outbound domestic gateways with inoperative Flight Management Computer (FMC), but may continue series of flights for repair interval specified in the Repair Int Category section.

placard.para: Placard affected Left or Right FMCS Control Display Unit (M76, M77) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: (Preferred to place inoperative FMC in the right FMC position.)
